Notes.Text:
This update for gssproxy fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2020-12658: Fixed an issue where gssproxy was not unlocking cond_mutex before pthread exit in gp_worker_main() (bsc#1180515).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15 SP2

Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** gssproxy (aka gss-proxy) before 0.8.3 does not unlock cond_mutex before pthread exit in gp_worker_main() in gp_workers.c. NOTE: An upstream comment states "We are already on a shutdown path when running the code in question, so a DoS there doesn't make any sense, and there has been no additional information provided us (as upstream) to indicate why this would be a problem."

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15 SP2:gssproxy-0.8.2-3.6.1
